objects.definition: Specimen collection of ambient air or sensor emplaced to measure properties of ambient air.
objects.name: Air

objects.definition: An instrument, sensor or other piece of human-made equipment upon which a measurement is made, such as datalogger temperature or battery voltage.
objects.name: Equipment

objects.definition: Gas phase specimen or sensor emplaced to measure properties of a gas.
objects.name: Gas
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: A habitat is an ecological or environmental area that is inhabited by a particular species of animal, plant, or other type of organism.
objects.name: Habitat
objects.note:
Necessary to describe ecosystem properties, such as: birds per km2 of habitat

STORET definition: The habitat conditions at the monitoring site; physical features of the area surrounding the monitoring location site.
objects.provenance:
Adopted from STORET into USGS National Water Quality Portal. http://waterqualitydata.us/portal_userguide/#WQPUserGuide-Table2
Definition from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Habitat

objects.definition: Sample collected as frozen water or sensor emplaced to measure properties of ice.
objects.name: Ice

objects.definition: Specimen collected as liquid water or sensor emplaced to measure properties of water in sampled environment.
objects.name: Liquid aqueous
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: Specimen collected as an organic liquid.
objects.name: Liquid organic
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: Specimen collected as a mineral.
objects.name: Mineral
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: There is no applicable sampled medium.
objects.name: Not applicable
objects.note: This term should be used in the case that there is no medium or medium does not apply in some context.
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: Data collected about a species at organism level.
objects.name: Organism

objects.definition: Other.
objects.name: Other
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: Specimen collected from particulates suspended in a paticulate-fluid mixture. Examples include particulates in water or air.
objects.name: Particulate
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition:
The entire unconsolidated or secondarily recemented cover that overlies more coherent bedrock, that has been formed by weathering, erosion, transport and/or deposition of the older material. The regolith thus includes fractured and weathered basement rocks, saprolites, soils, organic accumulations, volcanic material, glacial deposits, colluvium, alluvium, evaporitic sediments, aeolian deposits and ground water.
Everything from fresh rock to fresh air.
objects.name: Regolith
objects.note: The term was introduced by Merrill (1897) who wrote of the incoherent mass of varying thickness covering the underlying rocks: “In places this covering is made up of material originating through rock weathering in-situ. In other instances it is of fragmental and more or less decomposed material drifted by wind, water or ice from other sources. This entire mantle of unconsolidated material, whatever its nature or origin, it is proposed to call the regolith, from the Greek words rhego), meaning a blanket, and lithos, a stone.”
objects.provenance: Merrill, G. P. (1897) A treatise on rocks, rock weathering and soils. New York, Macmillan. 411 pp.

objects.definition: Specimen collected from a naturally occuring solid aggregate of one or more minerals.
objects.name: Rock
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php. Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_(geology)

objects.definition: Specimen collected from material broken down by processes of weathering and erosion and subsequently transported by the action of wind, water, or ice, and/or by the force of gravity acting on the particles. Sensors may also be emplaced to measure sediment properties.
objects.name: Sediment
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php. Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sediment

objects.definition: Observation in, of or sample taken from snow.
objects.name: Snow
objects.provenance: Adapted from CUAHSI HIS SampleMediumCV.  See http://his.cuahsi.org/mastercvreg/edit_cv11.aspx?tbl=SampleMediumCV.

objects.definition: Specimen collected from soil or sensor emplaced to measure properties of soil. Soil includes the mixture of minerals, organic matter, gasses, liquids, and organisms that make up the upper layer of earth in which plants grow.
objects.name: Soil
objects.provenance: Adapted from SESAR Material CV. See http://app.geosamples.org/reference/materials.php

objects.definition: Sample of a living organism's tissue or sensor emplaced to measure property of tissue.
objects.name: Tissue

objects.definition: The sampled medium is unknown.
objects.name: Unknown
objects.provenance: Adapted from CUAHSI HIS SampleMediumCV.  See http://his.cuahsi.org/mastercvreg/edit_cv11.aspx?tbl=SampleMediumCV.

objects.definition: The plants of an area considered in general or as communities, but not taxonomically.
objects.name: Vegetation
